races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description:
Rakkles are reptilian humanoids originally found on a remote planet in the Rim. After their discovery, human colonies rounded them up and genetically altered them to have near-human intelligence, but also decreased aggression and appearances better suited to human tastes. They were also modified to give birth to females more often than males, creating a biological need for species interbreeding.

The newly created Rakkle species were managed by a company known as The Cradle beyond the reaches of the galaxy, while wild Rakkle were hunted and killed to protect the company's interest. Future generations within the facilities were conditioned and raised as slaves and livestock.

 After a series of escapes and revolts on planet after planet, a coalition of freed Rakkle began colonies of their own, resisting capture and invasion to create a new world where Rakkle can live outside the yoke of slavery. Despite The Cradle's best efforts, these settlements continue to grow in size and number.
races.name: rakkle

races.description:
Genetically modified giant sentient bee-ings. Originally created by humans as a terraforming bio-tool for the proliferation of angiosperms, these flightless bees are found on countless terraformed rimworlds.
 Apini are often wiped out by the point a planet reaches urbworld status. 
 They possess some mamalian DNA, such as complex lung structure. Apini will also happily intergrate themselves into human "hives" if they feel like they have purpose.
races.name: apini

races.description:
An azure offshoot of the Apini, Azuri are simple-minded ravenous insectoids with a swarm like structure. They propagate by laying their eggs in hapless Apini, eventually killing the host bee in the process.
Noone knows where the Azuri originated from, but it is well known how they spread across the rim. Many an urbworld (with a government based on a basic set of ethics) have reached a level of development where the primitive Apini are an obstruction. However removing them would be considered genocide of sapient beings. To circumvent ethical laws, some leaders will stealthily import live Azuri eggs. 
The Azuri are like wildfire; they will destroy all Apini hives they come across, hunting down any stragglers. Unfortunately, they do not prepare like Apini, often dying of starvation and cold (usually after they run out of to kill).

No, that's the beautiful part. When wintertime rolls around, the Azuri simply freeze to death
races.name: azuri

races.description: What happens if you want to terraform a planet that has very poor or even no soil? What if there are hostile flora and fauna? The Apini terraform and survive by planting and harvesting flowers. You would need to create a race that was better at fighting and able to use an alternate food source.A more hearty alternative for planets where the Apini can't survive long enough to terraform the planet.And so with a slight change to the Apini DNA, splicing in Vulture/Carrior bee genes, the Necropini were born. Stronger and more resistant than normal Apini, and with the ability to make meat honey;the Necropini (or Death Bees) were created to terraform worlds that normal Apini would not survive on.
races.name: necropini

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.
\Tri-Jaws are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with A powerful red burst laser weapon can be fired at up to 2 people, and can be fired at 1 person while moving.

If the Tri-Jaws are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Tri-Jaw

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.

Dreadnaughts are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with low-angle intercepting systems. Unlike low-angle shields, they deny both incoming and outgoing projectiles.(Dlc) 

If the dreadnaughts are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Dreadnought

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.
\Hive guard are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with High-angle intercepting systems. Unlike High-angle shields, they deny both incoming and outgoing projectiles.(Dlc) 

If the Hive guard are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Hive guard

races.description:
Anties are genetically engineered beings by a private company to replace dying soldiers on the battle field.

Everything has gone south when the company has let their guard down to celebrate their recent progress. Due to a mistake made by one of the employees, the Anties have been set free from the lab and ended up in space.

Their personalities are gentle by nature, but they were made to know only but war. On each planet they end up, they burn everything down to ash, using themselves as the main source of the fuel.

Anty is hermaphrodite, has no externally exposed reproductive organs, but has both a scrotum and ovaries in the abdomen.

Anty's gender is indicated based on her reproductive system, which was a little more developed prior to consuming the Nutritional jelly.

The average height of common anty ergates and queen ants is 140cm, while soldier ants are 170cm. Depending on needs or the type of hive, it can transform or grow up to 200cm.
races.name: Anty

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: Human (FA Disabled)

races.description: It is a human like a rodent gene. Although the origin is unknown, it is a monarchy society based on agricultural society. There are more female objects than males, and it is difficult to distinguish the gender of the object when viewed from the outside.
races.name: Ratkin

races.description: It is a human like a rodent gene. Although the origin is unknown, it is a monarchy society based on agricultural society. There are more female objects than males, and it is difficult to distinguish the gender of the object when viewed from the outside.
races.name: Ratkin subject

races.description: Xenohuman race known for their crystalline purple and blue hued skin and hair as well as their affinity for psychic phenomenon. Diverging from Humanity several millennia ago, their biology contains a high concentration of a peculiar form of silica based mineral, giving them their unique hues and dense skin. Crystalloids originate from an area of space called the "Mechanoid Exclusion Zone", a dangerous area in space dominated by hostile AI, how they survived or even escaped it is not understood. Crystalloids typically inhabit the outer worlds, away from the core, and often end up on rimworlds and other fringe worlds.
races.name: crystalloid

races.description: Xenohuman variant race, born from Crystalloids from unknown conditions. Valkyries are a strong, combat oriented, and carnivorous all-female race with the same psionic capabilities as Crystalloids. Valkyries are hated by the Crystalloid Collective, who actively seeks to exterminate them. The ones who flee from the clutches of the Collective often find refuge in human communities.
races.name: valkyrie

races.description:
It is a humanoid race with falcon wings on its back.

 They have high reflexes and the ability to fly with wings, so they use mercenaries in other  faction.
races.name: Hawkia

races.description:
The heruan are a race of genetically modified xenohumans hailing from a remote glitterworld established during the First Wave of Exploration. Direct descendents of the people of Old Earth, the heruan people sent forth the Triune Expedition Fleets in the wake of the fall of Old Earth and the collapse of the Origin Systems, their mission to catalogue and preserve the breadth of humanity in order to keep their memories alive for posterity.

Heruan society is centered around the Triune castes of Sun, Moon, and Star. These are not hereditary castes but ones adopted in adulthood; heruan adolescents are expected to aspire to and train themselves for future inclusion into a caste.

Heruan are sleek and nimble with powerful legs. They are swift on foot and their powerful talons can be dangerous in a fight, but their relative frailty makes them poor combatants overall. Heruan are naturally inquisitive and eager to learn about unfamiliar people and cultures, preferring intellectual and creative pursuits over the prosecution of war. However, they understand that sometimes the only way to preserve the memory of others is to defend oneself against those who would destroy them.
races.name: heruan

races.description: Heyras settled in Rimworld a long time ago. They possess a unique psychic ability to, occasionally, hear whispers in their heads. Despite these whispers being mostly scattered words, Heyras believe they are the oracles of God. We do not know if these whispers are real. But it is confirmed that Heyras have a higher psychic sensitivity than humans.
races.name: Heyra

races.description: These savage barbarians are the nemesis of Heyras. They have thrown away the sense of moral and pursuit the primal pleasure. A series of evidence indicates that Rong is a separated branch of Heyra, although the Supreme Hierarch of Heyra denies this in all her strength.
races.name: Rong

races.description: Geneticaly-modified space-warrior foxgirls.
races.name: hisa

races.description:
Kurin, The Three Tailed Fox.

"Kurin" is a biological species born from genetic engineering of a prosperous glitterworld. Their DNA does not have the flaws that natural evolutionary processes have filled human DNA with. Moreover, they have great extensions to "genetic human base", such as three fox-like tails, fox-like ears, increased agility, better vision and hearing, better sensory organs, etc.
races.name: kurin

races.description:
"Kimiri" is a biological species born from genetic engineering of kurinworld. Their DNA is a mix of kurin DNA and DNA of dragon-like species that were discovered by kurins on one planet. They have some extensions to "genetic kurin base", such as tail of that dragon-like species, ears of that dragon-like species, more durable body than kurins have, increased toxic immunity of that dragon-like species, etc.

Kimiris and kurins are equal in society, but due to kimiris' weak abilities in headwork, they usually do physically demanding jobs.

Also kimiris are hermaphrodites, they have female and male "tool" inside of their body, so everyone of them chooses their gender themself.
races.name: kimiri

races.description: "Overlord" is a kurin mechanoid of class Kurin Republic Titan, created for heavy combat support and assaulting reinforced objects.
races.name: overlord

races.description:
"Peacekeeper" is a kurin mechanoid of class Kurin Republic Bouncer/Carver/Erecter, created for various tasks which depend on what kind certain peacekeeper has.

Peacekeeper bouncers are combatants, peacekeeper carvers are rescue workers, peacekeeper erecters are builders.
races.name: peacekeeper

races.description: "Smarty" is a kurin mechanoid of class Kurin Republic Smart Servant, created for various tasks which depend on what modules certain smarty has.
races.name: smarty

races.description:
stuffed by psychene love, sewed by red string.

Little is known about Luno except that they lives and moves with the energy they call as Lunatic. Some say they are haunted, others say it was a resurrection of the dead, but they don't talk about their identity. It is possible to turn a common stuffed doll as a Luno by certain acts, but some dolls suddenly became conscious of themselves one day. They are commonly born with their own complex family names, and say it is their father's name. Someone in the rimworld began to call them who were born with this phenomenon as Luno(Luna+Doll), which was literally cemented in their names.


Lunos eat psychite drugs, inhumane meat, and doll ingredients to fill the hunger. It doesn't seem to them that the side effects of psychite drugs are working. No one knows how they 'eat' it without a digestive system. in addition, no one has seen them excrete, either.
races.name: luno

races.description:
Tier one androids are simply humanlike-machines, designed to mimic the general image and minimal capabilities of humanity. Lacking true sapience, many view them like very intelligent and responsive animals. Their existence is to serve, and they do so uncomplainingly.

Due to minimal investment and design, tier one androids suffer from maintenance and efficiency flaws, leaving them relatively obsoleted by later, more durable, iterations - except for jobs where minimal specifications and resources is explicitly required or desired.
races.name: T1 Android

races.description: The most common tier of androids, tier two androids are classified as the lowest specifications required for fully autonomous sapience. When fully clothed or when viewed from afar, they are easily mistaken for shorter, scrawnier humans. Indeed, tier two intelligences are often the most humanlike and most likely to seek integration into human society.
races.name: T2 Android

races.description: Androids classified as tier three are often qualified by their large stature - standing at a height ranging from seven to nine feet - and impressive capabilities. They are incredibly durable, modular, and capable. Requiring extensive amounts of rare resources, they are generally only mass-produced on glitterworlds.
races.name: T3 Android

races.description:
The pinnacle of known android theory and practice, the class of tier four androids is marked by the possession of a special AI persona core. While these cores are ultratech technology, the chassis and internals are all high spacer technology. 

Tier four androids are a cut above the rest, and they know it too - ego complexes and disdain toward others are very common amongst them.
races.name: T4 Android

races.description:
Mark one warrior units are the standard baseline for military android variants - cheap, durable, and powerful. These are units crafted for war and war alone, and they are very good at it.

Its small, box-like shape earned it the nicknames of "battle-box" and "blaster-bucket," while its default red paint color and military role earned it the affectionate name "Redcoat." The unusual shape also prevents wearing humanlike apparel.
races.name: M1 Warrior

races.description:
Mark two bishop units, like their Mark 1 predecessors, are inhuman looking machines built for war. With six limbs that interchangeably act as legs and arms and backup internalized visual sensors, these slender, tall war units are exceedingly tough to take out of fights. More expensive than M1 warriors, the M2 is designed for fighting where mass quantity can't be engaged in full capacity and where a slight quality increase can win the day. These are units crafted for combat, both defensively and offensively, and can hold or push a line with steely determination.

Like its predecessor, it is incapable of wearing apparel and comes in a default red paint color. Due to its thin build and considerable height, it has earned the nicknames "deathstick," and "warpole," while its distinctive "head" segment earned it its most common nickname: "Bishop."
races.name: M2 Bishop

races.description:
The very first military variant idealized, blueprinted, and created by artifical intelligences alone, the mark three variant is as unique as it is aesthetically lacking in the form of a rectangular prism with two forward arms and four large manipulators. It has a very odd design choice: rather than being heavily armored to prevent taking damage, M3's instead have a highly reactive hyperweave-infused chassis that significantly reduces incoming damage. The more damage it sustains, the more resilient against damage it becomes - making M3's a warfighting champion. Specialized hardware vastly increases rate of fire.

The earliest M3's - contrary to expectation - took to their military role eagerly, and quickly developed a militaristic group ideology that often is likened to ancient chivalric customs. Duels, ritualistic combat, and mild disdain for non-combatants are common. While M3's exhibit no strong moralistic tendencies as a group, violence should be expected from individuals that are insulted or suffer breakdowns.

Due to their large size and shape, they earned the nickname "Warwagon" - but the proud M3's prefer to use the nickname "Paladin." Few are brave enough to challenge their choice. Many have died for making unflattering comparisons between paladins and mechanoid centipedes.
races.name: M3 Paladin

races.description:
Mark four units were an accident, originally borne of an ultratech society's misadventure with archotech research. This semi-gelatinous mass of mechanites takes human form, and has a plethora of odd properties. Devoid of coolant and distinct limbs, uniquely psychically gifted with a very human-like brain that can absorb archotech devices like mechlinks and neuroformers, possessed of a body that reacts to harm like paladins do, immune to overheating and freezing, even able to eject a mass of mechanites to incapacitate a foe in close combat at a cost to health, these are powerful beings indeed. Their creation requires a level of compression and energy only achievable under the weight of entire stars - but raving mad prophets claim the M4 is a hierophant, and can be "naturally born" by the true gift of the archotechs.

Despite everything, as a group, they behave like and have the desires of normal individuals. Others refer to the M4 as a "Jellyman" or "Gray goo," names of which the individuals do not seem to mind as long as they can participate in society on equal terms.
races.name: M4 Jellyman

races.description:
The Mark five is the product of ingenious engineering and a startling lack of actual creativity. Necessitating an orbital production facility with instruments of picoscoping precision and an interstellar empire's worth of logistical supply to manufacture, the Mark five is a testament to human achievement. It is, however, still generally considered a collosal failure of a design. Inexplicably, designers gave it a humanlike form and built it in a way that made it wholly incompatible with pre-existing technology and tactics, even going so far as to somehow give it less actual intelligence than a mark two.

How such a machine ended up here is not understood, but it is safe to say this is likely one of the single most dangerous entities on the planet.
races.name: M5 Titan

races.description:
A sentient race of insectoids derived from the same projects that created the megaspiders found throughout the rim worlds. Arranged in eusocial hive-like societies they are often found with many lesser insect castes. Though all of these insects are mantodean, most cultures only refer to the "sentient" mantodean as the race.

Mantodean queens stand as leaders in their hives, with subservient kings and overseers. Queens determine when broodmother eggs are used for new "sentient" mantodean or other castes, while other hive decisions are made by administrator mantodeans chosen among their peers for their cunning and guile. The hive divides its members by the roles they play in their society and see everyone as expendable. 

The culture and alien nature of mantodeans, coupled with their hostile expansionist mindset as well as their propensity to see other species (and even their own dead) as little more than food, has caused a deep resentment from more civilized cultures for obvious reasons. 

Mantodeans and the Shattered Empire are bitter enemies and neither side remembers exactly why. Rumor abounds that Mantodeans may have been commissioned by the Empire long ago to combat the Mechanoids, their intelligence and adaptability being especially effective. Perhaps too effective. Legends tell of whole worlds being covered in mantodean hives and their Hiveminds turning them against their creators. These hives were eventually shattered, leaving the mantodeans spread across the rim worlds as little more than tribal hives.

These tribal hives fall into two categories. The Lost Hives or Feral Hives that constantly raid and seem to only devour what stands before them, and the Infected Hives that appear to be under the effects of a fungal infection that greatly calms them and spurs them to trade and focus more on farming their jellyphids. Both categories will attack the Shattered Empire without regard.

Some hives will redevelop new hiveminds, becoming coupled once again to the ancient hives. These hives begin to advance quickly, even reaching an amalgamation of spacer level tech.
races.name: Mantodean

races.description: A race that lives on the ruins of an unknown civilization. Also called Far North or Yeti, they live in a small society over a wide radius.
races.name: Maru

races.description: A mutant of the catgirl species that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Catgirl

races.description: A mutant of the wolfgirl species that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Wolfgirl

races.description: A mutant of the foxgirl species that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Foxgirl

races.description: A Cowgirl that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Cowgirl

races.description: A Harpy that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Harpy

races.description: A mutant accumulation of slimy liquid that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Slime

races.description: A Baphomet that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Baphomet

races.description: A Centaur that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Centaur

races.description: A mutant of the Forest Fairy species that has developed a semblance of intelligence./n A fragile existence that withers in a toxic environment.
races.name: ForestFairy

races.description: A mutant of the Ice Fairy species that has developed a semblance of intelligence./n A fragile existence that cannot survive warm temperatures.
races.name: IceFairy

races.description: A mutant of the Dragon species that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Dragon

races.description: A mutant of the Thrumbogirl species that has developed a semblance of intelligence.
races.name: Thrumbogirl

races.description:
A small friendly gelatinous being.
Moonjellies are quick and nimble, and exceptionally skilled with medicine.
But be warned, their delicate bodies make them poor combatants and very vulnerable to danger.
races.name: Moonjelly

races.description:
A humanoid race living in cities under the sea. Having traits similar to sea creatures, their blood contains substances that can be used for various medical uses.

Descendants of glitterworld explorers who settled in the deep sea, generations of body modifications has led to their current form. Spreading far and wide into the rim, they built many cities and prospered. Until now.
races.name: Moyo

races.description: A subspecies of the Moyo race, usually babies born after Moyo fertilized by creature infected with the Leviathan virus. And because the symbiotic virus affects, most of them have strange personalities, but not intrinsically bad.
races.name: Red Moyo

races.description: Nakin, a beautiful and brutal race.They are good at sneaking up on their prey and shredding the poor things with their sharp claws.The thick fat-bags on their heads make it possible for them to heal quickly after injury.But defective eyesight makes them unable to handle range weapons.Nakins are just born fighters, they are not good at communicating and convincing others.
races.name: Nakin

races.description: The mysterious horned and feathered humanoid found on some rim worlds, Oni are often sought out by Glitterworlds for their beauty as a sort of exotic pet. Worse still some are kept as livestock for their feathers, pelts and horns, all having pratical and decorative uses. Oni live in temperate areas and rarely employ clothing due to the uncomfortable sensation on their feathered bodies.
races.name: Oni

races.description: The ancient ancestors of the current Oni that can be found on some rim worlds. They have been mysteriously appearing with no traceable origins, but their descendant race welcomes them into their tribes without question.
races.name: Ancestral Oni

races.description: A robust race of fighters, the Logann boast an uncanny regeneration factor.
races.name: Logann

races.description: A baseline orassan, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Orassia planets. A mammalian humanoid feline race. Evolving in cold caves and life on space ships make it so they don't mind the dark or being inside for long periods of time.
races.name: orassan

races.description: A hybrid with DNA from a human and an orassan. Typically created through careful genetic engineering in a lab, or the "natural" way from individuals with closely regulated gene mods, these hybrids combine some of the best traits from their parent species. The particular traits and physical characteristics that are being inherited are typically chosen by the parents having the child, but they almost always have two feline ears and a feline tail, both with fur sharing the same color as the hair on their head.
races.name: neko

races.description: This pawn is automaton designed by PnL Industry.
races.name: Paniel

races.description: A bloodthirsty vulpine near-human.
races.name: Revia

races.description: Elegant mono-gender race. Native to the planet Thessia, Asari are often considered the most influential and respected sentient species in the galaxy, and are known for their, diplomacy and biotic aptitude. Asari can often use biotic powers without the need of biotic amplifiers.
races.name: asari

races.description: An omnivorous, reptile-like race that was rescued from their dying homeworld by the hanar. Since then, the drell have remained loyal to them for their camaraderie and have fit comfortably into galactic civilization. Their culture allows Drell to separate their mind from their body, helping them through hard times and work. They are predisposed to Kepral's syndrome, a lethal condition which can develop if Drell stays in cold temperatures too long.
races.name: drell

races.description:
A humanlike-mechanoid that utilizes a highly sophisticated subpersona core to approach a live human in its thought complexity; however, their "minds" are of a very different nature. And are incapable of emulating complex emotions.

While they possess a degree of individuality, mechanents are not fully sentient - relying on mimicry of human behavior to appear less mechanical.
races.name: mechanent

races.description: The avatar of an AI persona core - a fusion of archotech and bleeding-edge technology, their vessels are often analogous and strikingly identical to a live human. They're both reviled and revered by human cultures.
races.name: persona

races.description: A tree-like creature of unknown origin, dryads often have specialized castes for performing different tasks around the colony. They also can regrow body parts and are capable of sustaining themselves through photosynthesis, but will need to eat flesh if sunlight becomes unavailable.
races.name: dryad

races.description: A race of human with DNA coming from a species of solitary bee, likely closely related to the blue carpenter bee. Unlike the average european honey bee girl these creatures do not form hive but wonder the rim alone scavenging and living off the land, they are adept at foraging wild plants. While compared to man they are much weaker and their lifespans short but they do hold a bit of a sting and a chitonous skin comaparable to a spelopede.
races.name: Solitary Bee Girl

races.description:
Valkyries - an ancient race created to resist the mechanoids. Despite all the genetic changes, they are almost indistinguishable from humans in appearance, with the exception of the not rare presence of tails, horns, additional pairs of ears and other minor distinguishing features.<color=#a2c8ff>

According to the original idea, mutations were supposed to be a replacement for the degradation of organs and not be so obvious. However, with the change of generations, less "human" and more "alien" representatives of this race began to appear, some of which are only indirectly related to the valkyries.

One of the significant genetic deviations was the complete degeneration of the male half of this race, which is why this race consists entirely of girls and was called the valkyries. But despite this, the representatives of the valkyries race have full compatibility with non-genetically modified humans, thanks to which they have not become extinct.</color>

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> Valkyries have a significant bonus to melee and survivability, which compensates for the inability to wear some armor.
races.name: valkyrie

races.description:
A rare subspecies of valkyrie that hybridizes with Gauranlen sprouts.

Usually mutations change Valkyries slightly, an additional tail, an eye, or unusual abilities. In the case of the gaurkyries, the mutation brought about significant changes in both body structure and brain structure, creating separate subspecies.<color=#f5ffa2>

Gaurkyries do not experience emotions, and the reproductive system has been modified so that they are able to "give birth" to small mammalian creatures - dryads. Dryads "born" by the gaurkyrie are different from the usual, although they have a direct relationship. They are something like a biomass that has no mind and is controlled directly by the gaurkyrie. The process of birth itself has nothing to do with how it occurs in mammals, since the biomass simply falls away from the gaurkyrie like shed skin. The mucus of the bomass itself accumulates on the body of the gaurkyrie along with sweat, or rather it is. The biomass covering the entire body of the gaurkyrie exists in synbiosis with her, protecting her from the effects of the external environment. The disadvantage is the flammability of biomass.</color>

Despite her size, the gaurkyrie is very heavy, which limits her mobility, however, despite the fact that she is slow, she can still deftly dodge blows.

Also on their heads, along with their hair, leaves grow like those of the Gauranlen tree, so leaves can fall from the gaurkyrie's head. Sometimes, instead of leaves of gauranlen, a seed may fall from it.

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> Gaurkyries are very tenacious and strong, but this does not make them invincible, keep in mind that their movement speed is incomprehensibly low.
races.name: gaurkyrie

races.description:
Equipment: Living Form - small humanoid helpers. They are miniature copies of the valkyries, their bodies are subject to the same mutations and aberrations. They were created to simplify the life of the valkyries, helping to treat wounds, cooking and psychological assistance.<color=#a2adff>

ELFs are considered adults from the age of 6, and their height does not exceed 1 meter. They are incapable of reproduction and new ELFs are reared in "mechanical eggs". Their bodies are small and light, and they can also hover in the air, but only for a short period of time.</color>

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> This race is very fragile, any damage can become lethal for them, but they have significant bonuses to psi abilities. Also ELFs can sleep while being held.
races.name: ELF

races.description:
Vic: "What the hell is that in your hand, Miss?"
XvA: "Haven't you seen this thing? It's a "Vibrating" weapon made for me by my master, little bro."
Vic: "......"

*Even if you are good at slicing bullets, please use the right weapon. When equipped with XF High Frequency Weapon, XF Red Stone Weapon, Bladelink Weapon, the character will definitely deflect the incoming bullets as long as they are not in close combat or stunned, but be aware that this will cause damage to the weapon.
*Nanomachines will repair a missing part of this unit in 4 to 6 days.
races.name: Black Apple

races.description:
The body fluids and muscles of cyborgs contain a large number of nanomachines that are loyal to the host and resistant to foreign objects.

*When equipped with XF High Frequency Weapon, XF Red Stone Weapon, Bladelink Weapon, the character will have a chance to chop off the incoming bullets as long as they are not in close combat or stunned, but be aware that this will cause damage to the weapon.
*Nanomachines will repair a missing part of this unit in 4 to 6 days.
races.name: Cyborg

races.description:
Yuran is an Ain race with the appearance of a rabbit, and its origin is not known precisely.
As a minority race with a small population, there are genetic problems and males do not exist. It continues.
Centering on the Miko with special abilities that are passed on through blood lineage, they live in a small village-sized village and have faith in the large cherry tree in their hometown.
races.name: Yuran

races.description: Miko serves and manages the village as a kind of duty for Yuran belonging to a family of special lineage.
races.name: Yuran Miko

races.description:
She is Miko who is fluent in curses.
According to the record, she even overcame death.
races.name: Yuran BlackSnake

races.description: It is a beautiful creature with human and dragon characteristics. It is mainly seen in the wild. Their silver-haired fur is hard and soft, making them expensive on the black market and often a target for hunters.
races.name: Dragonian

races.description:
Auri creation myth holds that the world was created by the Dawn Father Azim, god of the sun, and the Dusk Mother Nhaama, goddess of the moon. The two deities quarreled over which should rule the new world, and created mortals to serve as their soldiers to wage a war by proxy. These were the first Au Rathe Raen, children of the Dawn Father, and the Xaela, chosen of the Dusk Mother. At the culmination of their bitter struggle, the clans set aside their differences and learned to love one another, giving birth to a new generation. On seeing this, Azim and Nhaama returned to the heavens and bequeathed the world to their children.

Believing themselves the children of the Dawn Father, the forebears of the Auri Raen left behind their homeland to settle across Othard. They were received with hatred and hostility in the early years, until a prominent warlord of Yanxia, impressed with their valor, forged an alliance with the strange race and took them on as retainers. No matter where they came to be, with their innate martial prowess, they readily found employment as soldiers and carved out places for themselves within spheres of authority. Before long, the Raen had assumed a prominent role as warriors in service of countless great warlords, and their members spread across the Far East, from the lands of Nagxia and beyond the Ruby Sea to the isles of Hingashi, where they earned a reputation as legendary swordsmen. Yet not all chose this life. Some embraced a life of tranquility and solitude, settling in the deep valleys of Othard's mountainous eastern reaches. Others still desired to leave conflict behind completely, and availing themselves of Kojin wisdom, they created a great bubble of air at the bottom of the Ruby Sea, within which they built a villageSui-no-Sato. To govern their fledgling society, they founded a system of hereditary rule led by the Ruby Princess, under whose guidance they live a life of seclusion, away from the turmoils of the surface.
races.name: au ra

races.description:
Auri creation myth holds that the world was created by the Dawn Father Azim, god of the sun, and the Dusk Mother Nhaama, goddess of the moon. The two deities quarreled over which should rule the new world, and created mortals to serve as their soldiers to wage a war by proxy. These were the first Au Rathe Raen, children of the Dawn Father, and the Xaela, chosen of the Dusk Mother. At the culmination of their bitter struggle, the clans set aside their differences and learned to love one another, giving birth to a new generation. On seeing this, Azim and Nhaama returned to the heavens and bequeathed the world to their children.

Among the peoples of the Far East, it is believed that the Au Ra of the Azim Steppe were the first to keep livestock. They initially tamed horses to serve as mounts, and it was this achievement which led to the Au Ra's decisive rise to dominance over the plains. When the Raen subsequently departed their ancestral home, they took with them the knowledge of rearing and riding horses to the lands beyond the Steppe. After the horse, the Au Ra turned their hand to taming the yol, and these new mounts saw them expand their dominion to the skies above the Steppe. The Xaela have to this day not abandoned their ancestral home, living a nomadic life as hunters and gatherers on the vast Azim Steppe. With suitable grazing land sparse, conflict between individual tribes is common, with tribes forming, disbanding, and dying off in a ceaseless cycle of war and bloodshed. At last observation, Xaela tribes numbered fifty-one, though there is a high likelihood that recently splintered or merged tribes have rendered that count outdated. Of late, rumors swirl of a swelling of tribes who pledge spiritual allegiance to the Dusk Mother, and the abductions that have followed.
races.name: au ra

races.description:
Over the course of some one thousand years and three great migratory waves, the Hyur have come to be the most populous of the civilized races in Eorzea. Compared to the others, theirs is an average physique, both in terms of height and build. The Hyur champion personal freedom and liberty, and their espousal of an eclectic variety of languages and traditions is a legacy of their diverse heritageas is their resulting lack of a unified cultural identity.

The Highlander name comes from the clan's history of dominion over the mountains of Gyr Abania. Compared to their Midlander brethren, the Highlanders are noticeably larger in build and musculature. Following the fall of their ancestral homeland of Ala Mhigo, many have sought refuge in the bustling mercantile nation of Ul'dah.
races.name: Hyur

races.description:
Over the course of some one thousand years and three great migratory waves, the Hyur have come to be the most populous of the civilized races in Eorzea. Compared to the others, theirs is an average physique, both in terms of height and build. The Hyur champion personal freedom and liberty, and their espousal of an eclectic variety of languages and traditions is a legacy of their diverse heritageas is their resulting lack of a unified cultural identity.

The Midlander clan comprises over half of Eorzea's total Hyur population. The name derives from the clan's long tradition of settling in low-lying regions, though in truth Midlander lines hail from a wide variety of ancestral homelands. They have established themselves in every city throughout the realm, and can be observed leading lives as diverse as their heritage.
races.name: Hyur

races.description:
The Lalafell are a folk both rotund and diminutive. Small by any race's standards and possessed of a childlike countenance, it proves difficult for non-Lalafell to gauge an individual's age with any degree of accuracy. Originally an agricultural people inhabiting the fertile islands of the south seas, they found their way to Eorzea via the burgeoning trade routes. Lalafell are welcoming of outsiders, and share prosperous relations with all of the other races of Eorzea.

The Dunesfolk can be found on the scorching sands of Thanalan and other such arid areas. As the founders of the merchant city of Ul'dah, they are famous for their obsession with commerce. A natural inclination to transform ideas into action has served the Dunesfolk well in their business dealings.
races.name: Lalafell

races.description:
The Lalafell are a folk both rotund and diminutive. Small by any race's standards and possessed of a childlike countenance, it proves difficult for non-Lalafell to gauge an individual's age with any degree of accuracy. Originally an agricultural people inhabiting the fertile islands of the south seas, they found their way to Eorzea via the burgeoning trade routes. Lalafell are welcoming of outsiders, and share prosperous relations with all of the other races of Eorzea.

The Plainsfolk have settled in La Noscea and other regions where the ground is flat and easily cultivated. Though many live the life of farmers, it is not uncommon to see Plainsfolk residing in Limsa Lominsa, holding positions in the navy or working in the fisheries. They are well known for their relaxed and carefree demeanor.
races.name: Lalafell

races.description:
Though their presence in Eorzea is lesser than that of the other races, the Miqo'te are easily distinguished by their large, projecting ears and restless, feline tails. The ancestors of this line first made their way to the realm during the Age of Endless Frost in the Fifth Umbral Era, traversing frozen seas in pursuit of the wildlife upon which they subsisted. Instinctual territoriality causes many among them to lead solitary lifestyles. Males in particular are said to shy from contact with others.

The nocturnal among the Miqo'te have dubbed themselves the Keepers of the Moon. Shying from the garish light of day, they revel in the shroud of night, with most offering their piety to Menphina the Lover, goddess of the moon. Their tradition of hunting in the thick woodlands of the Black Shroud have for years thrown them into conflict with the forestfolk of Gridania, who condemn them as poachers. Of late, however, many Keepers of the Moon have found some small peace with the Gridanians, and taken to living within the city.
races.name: Miqo'te

races.description:
Though their presence in Eorzea is lesser than that of the other races, the Miqo'te are easily distinguished by their large, projecting ears and restless, feline tails. The ancestors of this line first made their way to the realm during the Age of Endless Frost in the Fifth Umbral Era, traversing frozen seas in pursuit of the wildlife upon which they subsisted. Instinctual territoriality causes many among them to lead solitary lifestyles. Males in particular are said to shy from contact with others.

The self-proclaimed Seekers of the Sun are the diurnal clan of the Miqo'te race. Their preference for the warm light of day pervades all aspects of their culture, as is apparent in their devout reverence for Azeyma the Warden, goddess of the sun. Though relatively few in Eorzea, a small number of them have been accepted into everyday life by the other races in the port city of Limsa Lominsa. Others are known to make their home in the region of the Sagolii Desert.
races.name: Miqo'te

races.description:
Of tall stature and slender frame, the Viera's physical appearance is strikingly similar to that of the Hyur and Elezen, save for their distinctive long ears. Adhering to a strict code known as the Green Word, they are prohibited from contact with the outside world under threat of exile. Their society is purely matriarchal, and males of age are seldom, if ever, found within the bounds of any village. They instead serve as protectors of the wood from the shadows, that no evil may ever encroach on their sacred lands.

Viera of the Rava clan live primarily in the Golmore Jungle, their umber skin allowing them to readily blend in with their surroundings. Though the males stand as wards of the forest, the females are adept hunters in their own right, fiercely guarding their homes and their young. Despite attempts by the Dalmascans to subjugate them, they have ever maintained a self-governing dominion. Though most would adhere to the traditions of the wood, some few have chosen to venture out into the world.
races.name: Viera

races.description:
Of tall stature and slender frame, the Viera's physical appearance is strikingly similar to that of the Hyur and Elezen, save for their distinctive long ears. Adhering to a strict code known as the Green Word, they are prohibited from contact with the outside world under threat of exile. Their society is purely matriarchal, and males of age are seldom, if ever, found within the bounds of any village. They instead serve as protectors of the wood from the shadows, that no evil may ever encroach on their sacred lands.

With skin as fair as the snowcapped mountains towering above, the Veena clan make their homes in the forests lining the southwestern foothills of the Skatay Range. Like the members of their sister clan, the Veena live as hunters and gatherers, laboring not only to protect the woods, but to nurture them. As the winds of war swept up a number of those who left their mountain homes, many such hardened hunters chose to set out for the distant shores of Eorzea.
races.name: Viera

races.description: A cold hearted creature, embodying the wilds. They have a alluring speech and their branches constantly shifts. They eat rarely but when they do, they eat meat.
races.name: dryad

races.description: The Dryads, the spiteful protectors of the forest. A truer form of the cold hearted wraiths of Athel Loren.
races.name: wild dryad

races.description: The Dryads, the spiteful protectors of the forest. A dryad fused with anima spirits.
races.name: anima dryad

races.description:
Arachne race lineage can be traced back to Arachne homeworld where the temperature fluctuate between cold and warm.
Arachnes over thousands of generations began to adapt to these temperature and ables themselves to withstand cold but in return have less tolerance to the heat
races.name: arachne

races.description:
A race of humanlike robots which are mostly female in model variety.

The origins of these machines are mostly unknown. Some speculate they are escapees from a civilization which used them for labor and some just suggest they are outdated pleasure machines which got dumped by a passing space freighter.

By design by their previous masters they are weak physically but their raw fortitude is enough to make up for it. Beware of their biological reactor and capacitors violently exploding, if they die by overheating.
races.name: Android

races.description:
A race of rudimentary humanlike worker robots.

Usually found toiling around in colonies around the rim which got a resident tinkerer.

Not capable of sapience, however their relative cheap cost and ability to work around the clock make them valuable workers.
races.name: Droid

races.description:
A race of rudimentary humanlike warrior robots.

Usually found guarding the homes of the wealthy and offices of mega corporations. They show no mercy upon targets who fail to identify themselves. Are traditionally armed with miniguns and core launchers.
races.name: Battledroid

races.description:
A race of archotech humanlike worker robots.

Usually found toiling around in colonies around the rim which got archotech level tech. Capable of sentience to a degree, allowing them to research, train animals and even speak though they will not benefit from conversation. 

Archodroids are at their peak, outperforming even humans. 

Droids are not born and must be created.
races.name: ArchoDroid

races.description:
A race of archotech humanlike warrior robots.

Installed into military bases and highly sensitive areas. They show no mercy upon targets who fail to identify themselves and are traditionally armed with miniguns and core launchers.

Destroyers are at their peak in power and defensive capabilities. Destroyers possess four arms, each of which is highly deadly. Humans beware: bring an army to defeat this model.

Droids are not born and must be created.
races.name: Destroyer

races.description: A baseline Black Widow, a being possessed of two separate inter-linked minds and spiderlike features. Infamous for their tendency toward violence in the pursuit of mates.
races.name: black widow

races.description: The resulting type of Android when Crystalloids were used as a template. This exceedingly rare variant of androids are not quite like a Crystalloid nor a standard Android.
races.name: crystalloid android

races.description: The Assaultron unit is a nimble assassin robot.
races.name: Assaultron

races.description: The Mister Gutsy, unlike the Mister Handy, is a dedicated combat robot. This model was commissioned by the U.S. Army just before the Great War.
races.name: Mister Gutsy

races.description: The first Mister Handy was introduced to the robotics market in 2037 by General Atomics International, as a general purpose construction and maintenance unit. Used widely on both the American and Mexican markets (especially after the Mexico City earthquake of 2042), it was a rugged, reliable design. So reliable, in fact, that it only received one major hardware update in 2039, to eliminate a bug causing interference in the operation of the multiple arms. The Calpower 238B nuclear power unit and self-maintenance modes were key to its success, ensuring each robot's longevity. To minimize maintenance overhead, each Mr. Handy was designed to perform its own nuclear fuel replacement and radiation cleansing, as well as carry out maintenance and repairs on other units (it was not possible for it to carry it out on itself).
races.name: Mister Handy

races.description: A version of Mr. Handy encountered at Milton General Hospital, with two saw blade attachments.
races.name: Nurse Handy

races.description: The Protectetron unit is a slow worker.
races.name: Protectetron

races.description: The Scrapbot unit is a small weak melee fighted made to haul.
races.name: Scrapbot

races.description: The Securitron unit is a mass-produced robot meant to keep a meaningful prescence and keep the peace.
races.name: Securitron

races.description: The Sentrybot unit is a thicc tanky robot.
races.name: Sentrybot

races.description:
A vat-grown underling created by the Folia to act as guards and raiders.
Very combat proficient, these fungal organisms' toxic touch lets them defeat even strong foes in hand-to-hand combat.
Their skill in any other labor, however, leave much to be desired.
+ Shooting Accuracy and Speed 
+Dodge Change
+ No food debuffs
+ Fast injury recovery
- very slow worker
races.name: Deathkap

races.description:
One of the regal and imposing Folia. Their plant-infused DNA lets them thrive in harsh temperatures and suppliment their diet with sunlight.
These xenohumans deign to involve themselves in hard labour, preferring to delegate tasks to their vat-grown underlings.
+ Great at trade deals
+ Low food needs
+ Access to tech to grow worker units
~ Huge social imapact
- often unwilling to do many work types
races.name: Folia

races.description:
A vat-grown underling created by the Folia to perform menial tasks.
Slow learning, yet hard working and hardy, these plant-based grunts are effective workers.
+ Bonus work speed
+ low break threshold
- Slow learning
- Dumb
races.name: Potatoid

races.description:
They were originally guards in a huge punishment facility spreading underground in another world. 
One day, they were seduced by a newly-arrived scholar and sucked out into this world through a "gate" that they were made to build (perhaps with the promise of an endless supply of alcohol, etc.). 
For a while afterwards, they worked together to find the scholar who had successfully escaped. 
However, they realized that their lives became mortal like the creatures of mortal world, and that their favorite things (alcohol, fighting, and human flesh) were available everywhere. In addition, the absence of their boss had destroyed their teamwork, and the all gokusotsu scattered to the planets to do as they pleased.
races.name: gokusotsu demon

races.description:
They were originally guards in a huge punishment facility spreading underground in another world. 
One day, they were seduced by a newly-arrived scholar and sucked out into this world through a "gate" that they were made to build (perhaps with the promise of an endless supply of alcohol, etc.). 
For a while afterwards, they worked together to find the scholar who had successfully escaped. 
However, they realized that their lives became mortal like the creatures of mortal world, and that their favorite things (alcohol, fighting, and human flesh) were available everywhere. In addition, the absence of their boss had destroyed their teamwork, and the all gokusotsu scattered to the planets to do as they pleased.
races.name: gokusotsu mezu demon

races.description:

In addition, the absence of their boss had destroyed their teamwork, and the all gokusotsu scattered to the planets to do as they pleased.
races.name: gokusotsu gozu demon

races.description:
The Half-Dragons have been a space faring race for quite a long time, contrary to popular belief these noble yet somewhat savage folk are not genetically engineered. They are easily spotted by their physical differences with humans thanks to their colorful scales, draconic eyes, horns and even tails! Thanks to their physical differences and strong scales people of this race proved themselves to be excellent melee combatants. It was easy to find them serving various empires outside of their own as front line fighters.

      Sadly due to their hardy nature and exotic looks many Half-Dragons end up captured and forced into gladiatorial combat. There are other reasons they are highly sought after; unique biological traits that are wholly unique to them. One of which allows to combine a specialized ore with their blood that activates various powerful abilities.

      A point of debate of many scholars is how such a openly savage race had made it to spaceflight, much less a force that roams about the galaxy. This is in large part thanks to a rare sub group of Half-Dragons that lead their kind in political, cultural and scientific endeavors. These "albino's" are almost the polar opposites of their more common brutish brethren. Despite a strong imperial nation and a sense of loyalty to their own, those that find themselves able to escape their gladiatorial slavery often form up as pirates. These pirates tend to be ruthless and a general nuisance in the galaxy.
races.name: Half-Dragon

races.description: It is a race with the genes of tigers, which is not well known on the planet, but has long formed a busy system. It is characterized by its small physique, high attack ability, and very quick agility.
races.name: Horan

races.description: It is a race with the genes of tigers, which is not well known on the planet, but has long formed a busy system. It is characterized by its small physique, high attack ability, and very quick agility.
races.name: Horan Spirit

races.description: The Lumin are an exotic alien race that are made up of a mix of rose gold and hard light outer shell, but with fleshy insides. The mix of metal, light and flesh not only make them much more durable than other races, but also quicker in terms of movement and mobility. Their only major downside is that they are a rare species that attempt to keep to themselves with the few bases they have.
races.name: lumin

races.description:
Matching the simplicity of their purpose, the simplicity of the grunt drone's design is its greatest feature. Designed purely for work, they are durable, capable, and persistent. Lacking the fine motor controls of less hyper-specialized designs, though, they are incapable of most complex tasks.

The most advanced elements of its design are its batteries and generators, which allow it to maximize its workflow and minimize downtime.
races.name: Grunt Drone

races.description:
Overseer drones are intimidating beings, inhuman and alien. With a single limb reaching from their spindly torso affixed with needle-like appendages, a trio of visual sensors that emit uncomfortable light, and an affixing stare, overseers are the scrying and analytical extensions of their masters. Capable of carrying out research tasks and the vital task of reprogramming and mending broken machinery, overseers are critical components in the massive scale machinery of fully automated drone hives.

While some believe them to have inscrutable sapience, they are still drones, and follow whatever programming they possess. Drones reprogramming drones is a nightmare for many, and overseer drones are often hunted for this very reason.

Their hyperspecialized design and sheer innate complexity leaves precious little room for much else.
races.name: Overseer Drone

races.description:
Mouthpieces of paranoid dictators, messengers of lords and organizations, diplomatic units between warring factions, envoys are the forward and expendable faces of those they serve. Without fear for self, ability to be autonomous, or to incite rebellion, these units form the cornerstone of any survival-oriented figurehead's public outreach programs. Fragile and unthreatening, these units rely on the vast apparatus of charismatic voices and personas encoded within them to cajole, convert, subvert, or simply relay messages to others. Unusual for a RimWorld given their cost relative to their value, envoys are rarely witnessed besides in the service of highly advanced drone hives or Ultratech wanderers.

While nominally designed for social tasks alone, they are versatile enough to perform tasks that do not require brute strength.
races.name: Envoy Drone

races.description: A demon hailing from the realm of Slaanesh. They are quick and agile fighters that dances around the battlefiel with grace and speed. They make excellent fighters but they tend to have cruel streaks and lack in the handy department.
races.name: daemonette

races.description: A human lured to the dark embrace of Slaanesh. They tend to be a bit colder personality wise but they are still human, mostly. Mutations can vary.
races.name: slaaneshi human

races.description: As perverse as any other follower of Slaanesh, these Daemon Princes are twisted into a form more pleasing to their master. These Daemon Princes are lither and far more graceful in their actions than Daemon Princes that serve the other ruinous powers. Their current form my restrict their ability to wear some apparel.
races.name: slaanesh prince

races.description: A Necron Lord is the most sophisticated of the ancient species of soulless, machine xenos known as the Necrons. A Necron Lord serves as the commander and energy supply for the much larger Necron armies composed of the standard Necron Warriors.
races.name: lord

races.description: Flayed Ones are twisted and ghoulish Necron terrors afflicted by an ancient infection that breeds a hunger for organic flesh in them. Flayed Ones act as specialised close combat troops. They appear from an unknown pocket dimension of their hideous kind to join the Necron armies in battle, though never by invitation from the Necrons themselves.
races.name: flayed one

races.description: Flayed Ones are twisted and ghoulish Necron terrors afflicted by an ancient infection that breeds a hunger for organic flesh in them. Flayed Ones act as specialised close combat troops. They appear from an unknown pocket dimension of their hideous kind to join the Necron armies in battle, though never by invitation from the Necrons themselves.
races.name: flayed one

races.description: A Canoptek Scarab is a small, silver, beetle-like Necron construct. These robotic scarabs are the most numerous and diverse of the Necrons' Canoptek machine servants. They are designed to break down organic and non-organic matter into raw energy, which can then be woven into fresh construct forms at the direction of the scarabs' controller.
races.name: canoptek scarab swarm

races.description: Canoptek Spyders are massive robotic Necron constructs, their immense weight effortlessly propelled by sophisticated anti-gravitic engines. Their bodies are large and rounded in the shape of a hooded carapace, in order to accommodate the internal systems that construct Canoptek Scarabs as needed.
races.name: canoptek spyder

races.description: Necron Warriors are the primary infantry troops of the soulless, undying mechanical monstrosities known as the Necrons. They were created from the majority of the ancient humanoid Necrontyr species who agreed to be bound to the will of their Star Gods, the terrible entities known as the C'tan. The Necrontyr's consciousnesses were transferred into robotic bodies made of the living metal called necrodermis. Over a long period of time, the new unliving bodies dulled the Necrontyr's minds and their abilities to feel emotion or pleasure. Over many millennia, the ultimate outcome of this process of gradual desensitization was that the Necron Warriors became little more than soulless automatons, the warrior-slaves of the still-sentient Necron royalty and military elite who seek to rebuild their star-spanning empires across the portions of the galaxy now controlled by the "lesser races."
races.name: necron warrior

races.description: Flayed Ones are twisted and ghoulish Necron terrors afflicted by an ancient infection that breeds a hunger for organic flesh in them. Flayed Ones act as specialised close combat troops. They appear from an unknown pocket dimension of their hideous kind to join the Necron armies in battle, though never by invitation from the Necrons themselves.
races.name: flayed one

races.description: Plasmancers are not subtle beings, for they choose to wield raw energy rather than go to the trouble of binding it into other forms. Thus are they known as "Harbingers of Destruction," as the spread of destruction is their gift to the galaxy.
races.name: plasmancer

races.description: A Necron Lord is the most sophisticated of the ancient species of soulless, machine xenos known as the Necrons. A Necron Lord serves as the commander and energy supply for the much larger Necron armies composed of the standard Necron Warriors.
races.name: lord

races.description: The Immortals were the favoured servants of the Necron dynasties in ancient days and now form the vanguard of their undying legions. When the Necrons first conquered the galaxy, they did so through the unfaltering and implacable onslaught of legion upon legion of Immortals.
races.name: immortal

races.description: Lokhust Destroyers are Necrons fused to floating chassis which serve as heavy weapons platforms. Essentially a modified Immortal, Deathmark, or Lychguard who have given up their physical forms in pursuit of destruction, these deranged agents of annihilation see their sole existence as quenching the flames of life. A Destroyer cares not for borders of allegiance, considering all forms of organic life to be its prey. Lokhust Destroyers are members of the Destroyer Cult, which is known for its rage and favor in destroying the enemy from afar.
races.name: lokhust destroyer

races.description: Lokhust Destroyers are Necrons fused to floating chassis which serve as heavy weapons platforms. Essentially a modified Immortal, Deathmark, or Lychguard who have given up their physical forms in pursuit of destruction, these deranged agents of annihilation see their sole existence as quenching the flames of life. A Destroyer cares not for borders of allegiance, considering all forms of organic life to be its prey. Lokhust Destroyers are members of the Destroyer Cult, which is known for its rage and favor in destroying the enemy from afar
races.name: lokhust heavy destroyer

races.description: The Skorpekh Destroyer is a variant of a standard Necron Destroyer that has modified its form to possess three legs rather than an anti-grav unit. It is driven into combat by a deep and uncontrollable insanity that expresses itself in the form of rage against organic life.
races.name: skorpekh destroyer

races.description: A Deathmark is one of the highly-skilled snipers and assassins of the Necron forces, appearing from apparently nowhere and striking with terrible precision. The name is fitting: once given the "hunter's mark", a Deathmark's targets are almost certain to meet their deaths scant moments later. Like most Necrons, the Deathmarks' technology lies far beyond the realm of human comprehension and they can effectively phase in and out of normal space-time at will.
races.name: deathmark

races.description: Hexmark Destroyers are six-armed Necron Deathmarks who are part of the Destroyer Cult and want nothing more than to kill everything around them. In battle, they burst from their dimensional oubliettes, and the Destroyers' corrupted engrams aid them in targeting and dispatching nearby enemies in a hail of Enmitic Disintegrator Pistol fire.
races.name: hexmark destroyer

races.description: The Lychguard are the elite protectors and emissaries of the Necron nobility. In order to serve as a bulwark against those who would harm their charges, Lychguard were gifted with the highest quality living metal necrodermis bodies, equal in resilience and power to those inhabited by the Necron Lords and Overlords they protect.
races.name: lychguard

races.description: Lokhust Lords are Necron Lords who have succumb to the Destroyer Cult and are overcome by nihilistic hatred. Others are Lords who were damaged in the Great Sleep and have been placed upon a Destroyer Body. Lokhust Lords are more machine-like than standard Necron Lords and are said to be the most maniacal of their kind, lacking any ability to emphatize with other creatures due to their cold, calculating nature. Even mighty Necron Overlords find Destroyer Lords somewhat disconcerting, believing they have too willingly embraced the machine and may turn on their own kind when the galaxy is rid of organic life. As a result, many are outcasts and pariahs in Necron society.
races.name: lokhust lord

races.description: The Skorpekh Destroyer is a variant of a standard Necron Destroyer that has modified its form to possess three legs rather than an anti-grav unit. It is driven into combat by a deep and uncontrollable insanity that expresses itself in the form of rage against organic life.
races.name: skorpekh lord

races.description: The Triarch Praetorians are a specialised caste of Necrons who serve as the judges and enforcers of ancient Necrontyr law. They are tasked with ensuring that every Necron dynasty upholds the terms of the ancient codes of law of the Necrontyr Empire to ensure that they are never forgotten nor ignored. Unlike other Necrons, Triarch Praetorians are not vassals of a particular Necron Lord or Overlord. As in ancient times, they possess the right to censure nobles who act against the interests or dictates of the Triarch and the Necrontyr codes of honour.
races.name: triarch praetorian

races.description: A Necron Overlord is one of the greatest and most powerful leaders of the Necron species, and the ruler of many Tomb Worlds. More powerful than even a Necron Lord, at a Necron Overlord's command are uncountable legions of Necron Warriors, terrifying war machines, and a vast array of devastating weaponry.
races.name: overlord

races.description: A Canoptek Scarab is a small, silver, beetle-like Necron construct. These robotic scarabs are the most numerous and diverse of the Necrons' Canoptek machine servants. They are designed to break down organic and non-organic matter into raw energy, which can then be woven into fresh construct forms at the direction of the scarabs' controller.
