More powerful than even a Necron Lord, at a Necron Overlord's command are uncountable legions of Necron Warriors, terrifying war machines, and a vast array of devastating weaponry.
races.name: overlord

races.description: The homeworld of the Vorcha, Heshtok, is a highly volcanic and toxic wasteland where the very water and air would kill most of the galaxy's inhabitants. And from that hellscape the Vorcha were birthed unto the galaxy. An incredibly short-lived, violent species, the Vorcha are viewed by much of the galaxy as pests, a blight on the face of the Milky Way. Possessing regenerative abilities, and an adaptability that only Heshtok could produce, the Vorcha can survive in almost any environment, and excel at brutal, base violence.
races.name: vorcha

races.description: A disreputable race native to the planet Khar'shan. The average Batarian citizen is forbidden to leave Khar'shan by the planet's authority, and those who do often fall into occupations of ill-repute. Many take up piracy and slavery in the Terminus Systems, and these bands of reavers swell in number with every passing moment.
races.name: batarian

races.description:
A once culturally rich and advanced civilization, the Krogan of Tuchanka were eventually reduced to war amongst themselves due to exploding birth rates during their industrialization, turning their homeworld into a nuclear wasteland. Two thousand years later, they were discovered and uplifted by the Salarians for the purpose of aiding in their war against the Rachni.

Krogan are over seven feet tall in height on average, and their bodies are covered in thick plates that are largely impervious to cuts and scrapes. They are also resistant to many environmental hazards, and have several redundancies in their internal organs, such as two hearts and a second set of lungs.
races.name: krogan

races.description: A race of bipedal amphibians from the world of Sur'Kesh, Salarians have tall, elongated bodies and horned heads. Their lives are short, only surviving around 40 human years, and they make up for this with their incredibly high metabolism, allowing them to function on less sleep, as well as work and think more quickly than most other species.
races.name: salarian

races.description: The first in an experimental line of mechadroids designed by a colonist in the inner rim. They use parts of disassembled mechanoids and as such share many of the same strengths and weaknesses. They have since developed their own personalities, settlements and culture, creating more of their kind.
races.name: Alpha-Series Mechadroid

races.description: A later design of Mechadroid, presumed to be created by the Alphas once they developed their own settlements as a means to protect themselves better.
races.name: Delta-Series Mechadroid

races.description: A later design of Mechadroid, presumed to be created at some point by the Alphas as a form of leader, or maybe just as a smarter version of themselves to handle their advancement.
races.name: Gamma-Series Mechadroid

races.description: A race of foxes who took on the mystical powers of the transcendent world and took on human form. Their body has an elegant organ in which the strength of their superpowers is determined by the amount of sunlight interlocked with the mechanites in their body. Because to this organ, foxes revere the sun and energy.
races.name: Miho

races.description:
Mincho is a slime-like race fully comprised of mintchoco ice cream.

ICEcRIM Co. created slime using mintchoco flavor ice cream with variant mechanite as an advertisement toy. However, due to an accidental mix-up during the final production stage, the wrong kind of variant, that was supposed to be disposed of due to critical defects, was used.

Mincho mimics human beings out of pure affection. They wish the humans to love them and "consume" them.

Due to the simplicity of body composition, they are capable of regenerating even severed heads, resilient against diseases, and endures most fatal wounds.

Differences in the nerve system made them also immune to pain and psychic waves.

However, Mincho is not capable of thinking, slow to learn and work, and weak against heat. 

When they are killed somehow (perhaps by having their core destroyed) they will turn into a lump of mintchoco ice cream.
races.name: mincho

races.description: A race of raccoon-themed spacers sent to the rimworlds by their archotech god.
races.name: Naki

races.description: A standard model of battle droid used widely as a baseline military model. They are cheap and easy to produce compared to other models so they are often also used as a labour force outside of combat.
races.name: B1 Battle Droid

races.description: A heavy modification of the standard b1 battle droid designed to be capable of handling some basic tasks, allowing it to fulfil the role of both servant and bodyguard to officials in the Separatist Alliance. This came at a much greater manufacturing cost, making them fairly limited in usage.
races.name: B1A Battle Droid

races.description: A stealthy model of battle droid capable of much more flexible movement, even imitating humanoids to a degree along with a high melee proficiency which the standard models lack almost entirely. They are much more difficult to produce.
races.name: BX Commando Droid

races.description: HK-47 was a Hunter-Killer assassin droid and Jedi hunter constructed by the Dark Lord of the Sith, Darth Revan, shortly after the end of the Mandalorian Wars in 3960 BBY. In the wake of widespread destruction caused by the Mass Shadow Generator, a superweapon used during the final battle of that conflict, Revan was inspired to seek more subtle methods of defeating his enemies. HK-47 was sent throughout the galaxy on his missions and successfully assassinated countless targets whom Revan had deemed threats to galactic stability and peace. However, HK-47 was badly crippled and captured on a mission in Mandalorian space shortly before Revan himself was captured by the Jedi Order.
races.name: HK-Series Assassin Droid

races.description: A strong security droid built for use by the Galactic Empire, originally intended to be deployed as a new form of battle droid, the backlash from the public against droids used for war after the Clone Wars led to them instead being used as security in Imperial bases.
races.name: KX Security Droid

races.description: An advanced assassin and bodyguard droid model, proficient in melee combat but not so much with ranged.
races.name: MagnaGuard Droid

races.description: A standard model of battle droid used widely as a baseline military model. They are cheap and easy to produce compared to other models so they are often also used as a labour force outside of combat.
races.name: protocol droid

races.description: An advanced battle droid model that is larger, tougher and generally better than the standard Battle Droid. Their advantages come at the cost of significantly more materials.
races.name: B2 Super Battle Droid

races.description: A superior model of tactical droid, capable of much more complex calculations than the standard series.
races.name: Super Tactical Droid

races.description: A droid capable of quick battlefield decisions, they aren't very useful for anything else but their intelligence is highly valued.
races.name: T-Series Tactical Droid

races.description: A race of parasitic living crystals growning on human bodies.
races.name: Quartzian

races.description:
History:
The Takala are a recent addition to life beyond the stars. As their home planet does not have surface metals or hard rock, the evolution of their planet is very different from that of earth. With no way for a prey species to make tools that could overcome their biological disadvantages like humanity did, the dominant animal of the planet was (and is) simply the biggest and most vicious predator. Towering over every other species in their homeworld, the Takala are that apex predator.

In their long time as the dominant species, they have also lived long enough to evolve an equally impressive intelligence. Takala are notably smarter than humans, having taken only a single generation to adapt to human technology and integrate themsleves into various rimworld colonies. Being a culturally violent species (a fact that has kept their population in check on their homeworld), they are also adept at warefare. With the reflexes to dodge melee attacks and the bodiliy finese to accurately fire weapons, they are natures perfect killing machines.

Humanity would probably have never have let these formidible beings spread out amongst their colonies if it werent for one impoartant fact: the Takala are relatively tiny. Standing at about 4 feet (1.2 meters) tall, their status as an apex predator on their homeorld means nothing when standing next to a human. And so, while naturally gravitating towards work in pirating and science, the Takala simply do not pose a significant threat to humanity. At least not yet.

Biology:
The Takala are not quite like any living animal humanity has come across before. The closest approxmiation would be a snake, but even that is mostly a visual similarity. Not having anything that resembles blood, the Takala dont quite bleed as much as they have bits of themselves fall out once a hole is big enough. Their brain is located where earth animals would call a stomach, with the destruction of their head simply being a major disability rather than fatal.  Portions of their body are also covered in incredibly tough scales, protecting them from attacks much in the way as a ceramic plate stops a bullet.
races.name: Takala

races.description: A creature that resembles a human in many ways, differentiated by the fact that is is an imitation human, grown in a vat for a collective hivemind.
races.name: bio-humanoid

races.description: An artificial imitation of a humanoid. Awkward and clumsy, this attempt is full of flaws, but its much better than nothing.
races.name: proto-humanoid

races.description: A specialised hive human filled with volitile chemicals and ready to explode upon a moments notice.
races.name: explodling

races.description: A giant mass of muscles, grown in a vat for its immense strength, not very bright but hits like a truck.
races.name: mega hulk

races.description: The queen and controller of a Human Hive. She is the source of life for all hive creature. Without her, the hive dies.
races.name: hive queen

races.description: A race known for grace, agility, and beauty.
races.name: Twilek

races.description: The legacy of a fallen empire, with a distant link to the humanoid races of earth and beyond. Other than the fact that they began to awaken over the past century, no one knows much else about what they are, where they are from or fundamentals behind their technology, which seems to bridge the gap between science and magic.
races.name: forsaken

races.description: Although died some time ago, now resurrected and wandering around for an unknown reason.
races.name: Skeleton

races.description: Not yet a skeleton, something woke it up too early. Its mind is fuzzy but its will is strong.
races.name: Zombie

races.description: Dirach or the Demon-Fiends, are most frequently seen among Fimir raiding parties. The Dirachs are feared even among the clans, occupying the high positions as advisor for the Meargh while mostly keeping away from the rest.
races.name: Dirach

races.description: These warriors are the forefront of the Fimir raids and the stalwart defenders of their strongholds. The true backbone of all Fimir broods, the hulking one-eyed monsters that men recon as true Fimir.
races.name: Fimm

races.description: Meargh or Witch-Hags are the revered females of the Fimir. They rule the Clans as matrons competing against the other mearghs. Selfish and cruel creatures that see themself as the absolute ruler and those that dare challenge a Meargh will find themself crippled from their blows.
races.name: Meargh

races.description: Shearl are the lowest caste of the Fimir society. With their smaller and weaker stature they acts as the clans servants and labourers. Those that manage to stand over the rest perform their arts in the workshops, forging armour and weapons off the highest quality. But on the battlefield the lowests of them acts as meat shields.
races.name: Shearl

races.description: Minotaurs, also known as Bullgors, are a massive bull-headed breed of the Beastmen race. Having a large body restricts their use of certain apparel.
races.name: bullgor

races.description: A common breed of the Beastmen. They make up the bulk of the beastmen herds roaming the lands. Gors tend to be vicious and bloodthirsty, but the rarer beastwomen tends to have a gentler side.
races.name: gor

races.description: A lower breed of beastmen. They are either born as mutants or changed into ones later in their lifes. Outcasts from human society they turn to the gor herds as a lower cast.
races.name: ungor

races.description: Skaven, ratmen or ratkins. They are a malevolent and diabolical race of large humanoid rat-creatures.
races.name: skaven

races.description: A large skaven, born stronger than the rest. They are bigger and stonger than the normal clanrats that lives across the skaven holds. They are aggressive by nature and are given to overt displays of prowess in order to intimidate those around them.
races.name: Vermin

races.description: A skaven with horns are blessed by the horned rat. They stand atop of the hierarchy, leading the councils with visions and advise.
races.name: horned skaven

races.description: Skaven of clan Moulder, often of senior-rank. Rat-men with vile knowledge of clan Moulder secrets, scarred and mutated form their practice in the laboratories deep under the surface.
races.name: Moulder skaven

races.description: A tribal warrior race, though generally peaceful.
races.name: Zabrak

races.description: Scorpians are a mutant species of scorpion with human-like intelligence. They are less aggressive and rarely display aggressive behaviour other than minimal feeding. However, it has been observed that on rare occasions they gather in large numbers and begin to act as a social group. Once a colony is established, they rapidly increase their technological capabilities, learn languages and attempt to gain social influence. Due to their inherent animal toughness, many factions regard their existence as dangerous, and large-scale extermination operations are sometimes carried out.
races.name: Scorpian

races.description:
A race of spacer-tech humanlike worker robots.

Usually found toiling around in colonies around the rim which got a resident tinkerer.Not capable of sapience making them perfect for colony tasks. 

Advanced droids are much better than their outdated models in every way. 

Droids are not born and must be created.
races.name: Advanced droid

races.description:
A race of spacer-tech humanlike warrior robots.

Installed into military bases and highly sensitive areas. They show no mercy upon targets who fail to identify themselves. Are traditionally armed with miniguns and core launchers.

Advanced droids are much better than their outdated models in every way. Wardroids possess four arms, each of which is highly deadly. Humans beware: bring an army to defeat this model.

Droids are not born and must be created.
races.name: Wardroid

races.description: Small drone constructed of simple materials built in short time. This device is masterful in building & mining, but is unable to do much else. Cannot fight.
races.name: engineer

races.description:
Small drone constructed of simple materials built in short time. This device is masterful in tasks relating to food & farming. It's designed to ensure everyone is fed and the kitchen is stocked.

This drone is unable to do combat nor any other skilled jobs.
races.name: chef

races.description: Small drone constructed of simple materials built in short time. This drone is highly capable in medicine, and is able to take care of most typical injuries.
races.name: medic

races.description: Avali small shooting drone. The ideal scout and target for distracting the attention of inattentive opponents were given. Due to the speed, it can fly from one edge of the map to the other VERY quickly. It also has the advantages of cheapness, but it is extremely fragile, which increases the chance of a battery explosion
races.name: ASSD

races.description:
Forgotty is a race that was discovered and identified in a laboratory buried in a certain location on the "Forgotten Continent" when research uncovered an individual that had been kept in storage. While its appearance, internal organs, etc., are almost identical to those of baseliners, the only part of it that is the brain is composed of mechanite and machinery. The only part of the brain that functions is a special part composed of mechanite and machinery.

According to a few sources, the creators of this race substituted the brain with a mechanite and a machine. The creators of this tribe, according to a few sources, were trying to create a human being who could create his or her preferred personality on demand by replacing the brain with a mechanite and a machine. However, due to the problems caused by replacing the brain with a machine, the project was eventually frozen. The project was eventually frozen.

Forgotty gains a certain amount of knowledge from various jobs, which activates the mechanite. Based on the activated mechanite, the parts that hit the brain can be upgraded. However, when upgrading a part, the memory must be formatted. The personality in the formatted parts will disappear without a trace.
races.name: Forgotty

races.description:
Glassy is a creature with horse-like ears and tail. Its body shape is similar to that of Mofy and it is said to be a close relative of Mofy.
The reality is that B.E.PFairyTech is a creature born as a result of one human's desire to live. After the first Glassy was born, it succeeded in increasing its numbers on one planet, and before long it began assisting humans and living in the wild on several planets.
They are not usually very fast on their feet, but when they get serious, they can move faster than little fairy.
races.name: Glassy

races.description:
LegacyFairy is a friendly, fairy-like race about the size of a human child. They were discovered during a recent survey of a recently discovered place called "The Forgotten Continent".

Research on their genes has revealed that the LegacyFairy's genes are almost identical to those of LittleFairy, and that the LegacyFairy's genes are almost identical to those of LittleFairy, It has been suggested that LittleFairy may have been created based on LegacyFairy. However, they have a slightly different power than LittleFairy's "brilliance power", However, they have a slightly different power than the "brilliance power" of the Little Fairies, they have the ability to manipulate destiny by dropping all kinds of materials near themselves. Some researchers call this power "wish power".

The details of this power are not known, as there are no documents remaining from before the discovery of this power. Perhaps they were once raised as a service tribe, and they are basically submissive to different species. However, some LegacyFairy factions, for unknown reasons, have been known to launch raids on heterogeneous factions. The reason as to why some LegacyFairies do this is still unknown.
races.name: Legacy Fairy

races.description: Little faeries are a flesh-loving, fairy-like race with tiny wings. They serve various species and perform miscellaneous labor. It is also said that littlefairy that have been feral for a long time become fearsome monsters that attack humans and feed on their growth.
races.name: Little Fairy

races.description:
MagiaPlant is a species that was discovered when research uncovered an individual that had been kept in a laboratory buried in a certain location on the Forgotten Continent.
Perhaps due to the influence of a special mechanite, the surface of their bodies was similar to that of plants, but their internal organs and other parts were the same as those of humans, except that they had some plant characteristics.
It was easy to increase the number of individuals for research purposes.
After a certain amount of research, the MagiaPlants were sold to various stars, or they set out on their own and emigrated to various stars.

When their emotions are aroused, they activate the mechanite in their bodies.
When their Mechanite is activated, they are able to use "magical" powers. but when they run out of magical power, they can turn into monsters.

<color=#FF5555>They consume MS when they use various abilities or recover mana rapidly. Please note that consuming too much MS and reaching zero will be fatal.</color>
races.name: Magia Plant

races.description:
Mofy are a race with fox-like white ears and tails. Once developed by humans as a "labor force that could also serve as food" Mofy have a variety of useful traits.

Nutritious milk is available from mature individuals. The milk, when drunk, temporarily boosts the immune system.

In addition, the meat is not very tasty and familiar to humans, but there is no problem in eating it.

They can build, craft, and mine quickly, but it takes them a long time to learn the rest of the things they are not good at.

Some Mofy's now live quietly in cold lands or deep underground in their kingdoms.
races.name: Mofy

races.description:
Sweety is a creature that is born when it eats B.E.PFairyTech's "magic chocolate" and takes over the creature's body. In the past, before the space war, B.E.PFairyTech used to serve "magic chocolate" to foolish humans and brainwash them into becoming Sweety to increase the number of "employees". Now that B.E.PFairyTech has been destroyed, new Sweety are no longer artificially created, but there are still many rare accidents where people eat the "magic chocolate" and are transformed into Sweety.

They basically do not die, no matter how much they are hurt. However, they are very sensitive to heat, and in hot places their bodies gradually melt and eventually evaporate.

They produce a very tasty chocolate milk.

<color=#FF5555>They can only eat chocolate, or something chocolate-like.</color>
races.name: Sweety

races.description:
The Infinity are a race made up of machines. They are made up of robots and use their own equipment and parts.

These are people from outer galaxies, each with different ancient human memories, but only a few. Most of them are made up of self-duplicates. 

According to the records of people I've met, the Infinities are found to be using similar techniques from the Transcendental world using a time-related stone called Chronos. I'm guessing it's a robot with a transcendental origin or a transcendental ego from an outer galaxy.
races.name: Infinity
